{{Infobox musical artist | name = Washboard Willie | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = William Paden Hensley | alias = | birth_date = {{birth_date|1909|7|24}}
[[Columbus, Georgia|Columbus]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], United States | death_date = {{dda|1991|08|24|1909|07|24|mf=y}}
[[Detroit]], [[Michigan]], United States | instrument = [[Human voice|Vocals]], [[washboard]], [[harmonica]], [[drum]]s | genre = [[Detroit blues]] | occupation = [[Singing|Singer]], [[washboard]] player | years_active = 1952–1979 | label = | associated_acts = | website = | notable_instruments = }} '''Washboard Willie''' (July 24, 1909 – August 24, 1991){{cite web|author=Doc Rock |url=http://thedeadrockstarsclub.com/1990.html |title=The Dead Rock Stars Club 1990 - 1991 |publisher=Thedeadrockstarsclub.com |date= |accessdate=2014-01-31}} was an [[United States|American]] [[Detroit blues]] [[musician]], who specialised in playing the [[washboard]]. He recorded tracks including "A Fool On a Mule in the Middle of The Road" plus "Cherry Red Blues", and worked variously with [[Eddie "Guitar" Burns]], [[Baby Boy Warren]], and [[Boogie Woogie Red]]. ==Biography== Born '''William Paden Hensley''' in [[Columbus, Georgia|Columbus]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], Washboard Willie, as he became known, did not take up music until his thirties. By 1948 he had relocated to [[Detroit]],{{cite book | first= Paul | last= Oliver | year= 1998 | title= The Story of the Blues | edition= 1st | publisher= Northeastern University Press | location= Michigan | isbn= 1-55553-355-8 | page= 179}} and in 1952, he watched [[Eddie "Guitar" Burns]] performing and played along with Burns' backing group. He impressed the proprietor and ended up with a three year residency with the band. Working full-time washing cars for a living, he decided to name his own [[musical ensemble]], Washboard Willie and the Super Suds of Rhythm, working off of the name of a once-popular laundry detergent! {{cite book | first= Paul | last= Oliver | year= 1997 | title= Conversation with the Blues | edition= 2nd | publisher= Cambridge University Press | location= Cambridge, England | isbn= 0-521-59181-3 | page= 172}} He graduated from just playing the washboard to incorporate a [[bass drum]] and [[snare drum|snare]] and, in 1955, gave [[Little Sonny]] his first booking. In 1956, Hensley made his own debut [[sound recording and reproduction|recording]] of "Cherry Red Blues," with "Washboard Shuffle;" and then "Washboard Blues Pt. 1 & 2."{{cite web|url=http://www.wirz.de/music/washbfrm.htm |title=Wasboard Willie discography |publisher=Wirz.de |accessdate=2014-01-31}} His recording career continued until 1962 utilising [[Boogie Woogie Red]] on [[piano]] accompaniment. The recordings were not issued until 1969 on [[Barrelhouse Records]]. However, in 1966, Willie did release a [[single (music)|single]] with the tracks "Natural Born Lover," and "Wee Baby Blues." His band remained in demand playing nightly in both Detroit and [[Ann Arbor, Michigan|Ann Arbor]]. In 1973, he toured Europe with [[Lightnin' Slim]], Whispering Smith, [[Snooky Pryor]], [[Homesick James]] and Boogie Woogie Red; he also played at the [[Ann Arbor Blues and Jazz Festival]] that year on the Saturday afternoon "Detroit Blues" show. A [[compilation album]], ''American Blues Legends '73'' was issued on [[Big Bear Records]] with Willie contributing the tracks, "I Feel So Fine" and "Kansas City." Six years later he stopped playing professionally.{{cite web |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p378368/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Washboard Willie |author=Reif, Fred |publisher=[[Allmusic]] |accessdate=February 11, 2010}} He died in Detroit in August 1991, at the age of 82. ==Recent discography== *''Motor Town Boogie'' (2007) - [[P-Vine Records]]{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/motor-town-boogie-mw0001902727 |title=Motor Town Boogie - Washboard Willie | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2007-03-19 |accessdate=2014-01-31}} ==See also== *[[List of Detroit blues musicians]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.wirz.de/music/washbfrm.htm Illustrated discography] {{Authority control|VIAF=43913007}} {{Persondata | NAME = Hensley, William Paden | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Washboard Willie | SHORT DESCRIPTION = [[United States|American]] [[Detroit blues]] musician | DATE OF BIRTH = July 24, 1909 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Columbus, Georgia|Columbus]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], United States | DATE OF DEATH = August 24, 1991 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]], United States }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Washboard Willie}} [[Category:1909 births]] [[Category:1991 deaths]] [[Category:American blues musicians]] [[Category:American blues singers]] [[Category:American male singers]] [[Category:Detroit blues musicians]] [[Category:Musicians from Columbus, Georgia]] [[Category:Washboard players]]
